result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roderick L McClinton

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Probable cause hearing on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark A Leonard in court for Roderick L McClinton.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. DE contacted court re: car issues. Parties agree to reschedule.
Probable cause hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defn contacted branch ref possibility of being late for hearing 9-23-22 due to car trouble.  Defn attempted to contact his atty and was advised to let branch know of further delays
Pre-trial conference on September 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Setover request of pre-trial conference 8-23-22 filed by defn
Defn contacted branch advising that he is eligible for SPD, but no one has been appointed.  Defn requested a setover for appointment of counsel and was advised to submit a written request
Pre-trial conference on August 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Cheyanne M except only for purposes of child custody exchange. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

11:10 AM Defendant appeared.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
